metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2526 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd. This issue occurs dueto the on_stream_io() function and dns_stream_complete() function in'resolved-dns-stream.c' not incrementing the reference counting for theDnsStream object. Therefore, other functions and callbacks called candereference the DNSStream object, causing the use-after-free when thereference is still used later.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
libnss-mymachines - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
libnss-resolve - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
libnss-systemd - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
libpam-systemd - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
libsystemd0 - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
libudev1 - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
systemd - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
systemd-container - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
systemd-coredump - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
systemd-journal-remote - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
systemd-sysv - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
systemd-tests - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
systemd-timesyncd - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
udev - 245.4-4ubuntu3.17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '245.4-4ubuntu3.17').
